* A Class 1 recall recall is defined by the U .S .  Food and Drug Administration (FDA) as a situation in which there is a reasonable probability that the use of or exposure to a violative product will cause serious adverse health consequences or death .  A Class 
2 recall is defined by the FDA as a situation in which use of or exposure to a violative product may cause temporary or medically reversible adverse health consequences or where the probability of serious adverse health consequences is remote  .2021 Highlights
